intro: Phanera wrayi var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean phanera, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It has palmately lobed leaves and is often found growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for tropical rainforest ecosystems.
